Interface org.webmacro.datatable.DataTable

public interface DataTable
extends List
An interface that adds methods to the List interface for managing tabular data.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Keats Kirsch
Since:
11-Sep-00

addRow 
public abstract void addRow(List vals)
add a row of values to the table

Parameters:
vals - a List of values that constitute a new row in the table.
addRow 
public abstract void addRow(Object[] vals)
add a row of values to the table

Parameters:
vals - an array of values that constitute a new row in the table.
formatError 
public abstract java.lang.String formatError(String errmsg)
formats an error message for display in generated page.

Parameters:
errmsg - The message to be formatted
Returns:
The formatted message
getColumnCount 
public abstract int getColumnCount()

Returns:
the number of columns in this table
getColumnName 
public abstract java.lang.String getColumnName(int i)

Returns:
the name of column i (one-based index)
getColumnNames 
public abstract java.lang.String[] getColumnNames()

Returns:
a String array of column names
getRowAttributes 
public abstract java.util.Map getRowAttributes()
This method gives access to a list of custom row attributes for a DataTable. A row attribute is a named list of values that are accessable by rows of the table. A single value is associated with each row in order, repeating when necessary. I.e., if there are N values in the list, the attribute associated with row i would be indexed by (i-1) modulus N.

For example, to associate a list of background colors with a DataTable referenced by tbl:

String[] colors = new String[]{ "red", "green", "blue" };
tbl.getAttributes().put("bgcolor", colors);
In a WebMacro template you could access the property thusly:

<table>
#foreach $row in $table {
<tr bgcolor="$row.Attribute.bgcolor">
<td>$row.ColumnA</td><td>$row.ColumnB</td></tr>
}
</table>

Returns:
a List of custom row attributes.
getSize 
public abstract int getSize()

Returns:
The number of rows in this table. It is the same as size() but it uses the Java bean accessor style so that it can be accessed as $tbl.Size in a WebMacro template.
getStartIndex 
public abstract int getStartIndex()

Returns:
The index of the first row included in this table.
